text: How can I copy my current theme to a sandbox in order to work without destroying anything? I’m a jr and still learning HubSpot and would like to work safely.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging>
Thanks Jacob. Please bear with my while I ask some questions. <@UG7S8J18D> How does this work for local development? I’m not understanding how to work locally with this.
Id like to but not sure if this is possible: clone entire site to a sandbox, work on it, push to production.
It's not local but an online sandbox with a different domain
There is no way to do a full local build like you can with wordpress
Also do you have a developer sandbox?
That is another option

After going through all of the documentation Im left with a good understanding of working locally to create themes / modules / etc. But I’m not left with a great understanding of how to work with an already existing site. Does HubSpot have documentation on this?
I do have a sandbox environment yes.
For page objects, you’ll want to use the content staging tool <@UG7S8J18D> linked to in the production portal.
This sandbox was used to follow the tutorials from HubSpot dev.
Are you doing a small change or a full redesign? Do you need to have page content exactly as it is live for testing? Or can you just use placeholder content for testing?
There is some documentation but not for every scenario so you might have to do some experimentation to see what works best
Ok I’ll tell you my current goals
I’m currently working on a site and am overhauling the mobile navigation, and multiple pages on the site. I’ve been working in the design manager but would prefer to make edits locally.
I would do a child theme and content staging for this what do you think <@U26BLKGE4>
Once approved roll your child theme changes to main theme
After reading this page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/child-themes>
It seems like this is exactly what I’m looking for
Ok great.
Once I’ve created a child theme. Can I simply fetch it in order to work on files locally?
<@UG7S8J18D> Very much appreciate your help with all this!
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli>
Yes you can. I would fetch main theme and cloned theme and move any files you want to update into clone and then do a watch on the cloned theme
Sorry, had a quick meeting, but yes this is exactly what I would suggest
Ok I’ve created a child theme and fetched both the main them and child to my local environment. I’m a little confused on watch
I’ve CD into my child theme directory but I’m not understanding the 2 arguments needed to run it
This is from the documentation
Nevermind. I needed to be in root in order to target the child directory. All good now.
I see watch you did there. :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
